title: Overeager `consider adding a #[cfg(test)]` for unused imports in `mod tests` with the cfg

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

Given the following code: https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=8d2bf12d3315c3719787852baf7e0ba0 (make sure to use TEST instead of BUILD even though there are no tests in this minimal example):

```rust
#[cfg(test)]
mod tests {
    use super::*;
}
```

The current output is:

```
warning: unused import: `super::*`
 --> src/lib.rs:3:9
  |
3 |     use super::*;
  |         ^^^^^^^^
  |
  = note: `#[warn(unused_imports)]` on by default
help: consider adding a `#[cfg(test)]` to the containing module
 --> src/lib.rs:2:1
  |
2 | mod tests {
  | ^^^^^^^^^
```

The `help: consider adding a #[cfg(test)] to the containing module` does not apply here, because that has already been added. The problem is that the import is just not used.

#59426 is an open issue that looks related to adding this message, for reference.
